text: [Music]
hello this is chef john from food wishes
comm with ricotta meatballs
that's right ricotta spiked beef
meatballs so tender so flavorful so
delicious and here's how you make them
super simple hardly any ingredients so I
took a half an onion and I you know
minced it up pretty small in a little
bit of olive oil over medium heat in a
saute pan you're just going to cook
those sweat those until they're
translucent or just about then I put in
some crushed garlic about three cloves
that depends on your garlic love alright
you can easily put more all right turn
off the heat there's plenty heat in that
pan and those onions to take the raw
edge off the garlic I'm going to pour
those in a mixing bowl and I'm going to
add one egg and make sure all these
ingredients you're going to see me add
here are really cold so one egg right
out of the fridge a cup of full fat
ricotta no skim ricotta
alright regular ricotta the best rocoto
you can get one cup of that and you're
going to whisk that in and the reason I
want that really cold is because the
onions were still kind of warm and when
you make meatballs
the colder your mixture is the better
alright we're going to put in some
seasoning a teaspoon and a half of
kosher salt black pepper to taste a lot
about a half teaspoon and a shake of
cayenne and I'm going to add one pound
of ground beef now here's where you're
probably going to have an advantage I'm
using grass-fed ground beef that I get
the supermarket it's really ground fine
I wish it wasn't ground so fine if
you're using regular supermarket ground
beef it's probably going to be even a
better texture
alright so dump that in with about 1/4
cup packed of fresh chopped parsley in
fact I had even a little more there but
I like parsley mix that in till it's
just about mix see that it's not quite
mixed it's about 65% mixed then I'm
gonna go ahead and add in my plain
breadcrumbs and I'm going to mix it up
till it's combined now usually when
you're making meatballs meatloaf things
like that people are so worried about
over mixing and yes you don't want to
over mix on purpose but because of the
ricotta cheese in this they come out
pretty tender so don't worry too too
much about over mixing so once it comes
together I'm going to use a little
sorbet scoop here because it makes nice
consistent sized meatball
those wet your fingers you know that
trick I've showed you that before wet
your fingers roll them into balls
so this one-pound beef batch with the
cup over Kota it's going to make about
thirty thirty two of these little
meatballs in the same pan you cooked
your onions in add a couple of
tablespoons of olive oil and brown those
on all sides and by the way the person
that sent me the email told me that
balls don't have sides come on you must
have something better to do
I know balls don't have sides but you
know what I mean Brown them on all sides
oh sorry
Brown them on all surfaces then I'm
going to take a piece of paper towel you
see me do this in many videos tilt the
pan let the towel soak up all the excess
oil and then the finish so simple I'm
going to add one jar 28 ounces of tomato
sauce and 1 cup of water I'm using a
nice brilla marinara it's my personal
favorite brand attention FCC I was not
paid for that comment and then simply
simmer for 30 minutes on medium low and
you're going to have some really
delicious meatballs go ahead and give
them a stir every once in a while like I
said the cheese really makes them moist
and tender just really really nice so
basic - you want to put more stuff in
there put more stuff but I didn't mess
it up with a bunch of extra ingredients
just simple basic food anyway I hope you
give those a try I really like this
recipe of course you're going to throw
them over some spaghetti because we're
Americans and that's what we do in
meatballs
sorry Italians they don't mix their
pasta meatballs why I don't know do you
think they would you know catch on how
good it is anyway go check out the site
all the ingredients are there and as
always enjoy
